fullDescription.intro:
This node can be used to load git log from file (offline version) or directly from git repository (online version). Currently only offline operation is supported
To use the offline version of plugin you need to generate git log in a specific format using the following command:
git log --pretty=format:"%H%n%ct%n%an%n%B%n%H" --raw --no-merges --abbrev=40
in the folder with your local git repository. Result of this command should be saved in file on your disk and this file's path needs to be given in "Selected file" field in configuration dialog.
This node analyzes information about every class in every commit from the given git's log file or git repository and returns a table with the following data:
name of class
file extension
marker
author of change
action
complete message from commit
original path of class
date of change
Unique ID of record
Action could consists of following values:
M - modification
A - added
C - copied
D - deleted
R - renamed
T - file type changed (i.e. regular file to symlink)
fullDescription.option: File with Git log to analyze in offline version of plugin

ports.outPort: Table with data read from Git log file or Git repository
